title: Kawase Hasui Paintings (1883-1957)
description:
Japanese artist Kawase Hasui (1883-1957)
307 JPEG | Up to (3100x2100) | 113 Mb

Kawase Hasui (Kawase Hatsu) (1883-1957) was one of the greatest artists of the shin-hanga style of the late 19th and early 20th centuries. Kawase studied ukiyo-e, Japanese style of painting in the studio Kiyokata Kaburagi. It is mainly focused on watercolors actors, everyday life and landscapes. Kawase in the West is mostly known as a master of Japanese prints. Unfortunately in the earthquake of 1923 was gone most of the works of Kawase Hasui. During the forty years of his artistic career, Hasui worked closely with Shozaburo Watanabe. In 1956 he was named 'Living National Treasure of Japan.'
